item.title: 2011-04-12 Airdate - ABATE Ohio
item.description:

Topics- Right of Way, Helmet Laws, Motorcycle Awareness, Handlebars, Motorcycle Parking
http://www.abate.com, May is "Moyorcycle Awareness Month"
item.author: mlweb@comrec.com

Laconia Rally and Races
Rider's rest Bike Hammock

item.title: 2011-05-23 Airdate - Riding on the Edge
item.description:
Guests
Dave Barr
Topics
In 1969, at age 17, Dave began his military career with the U.S. Marine Corps, receiving 57 air medals while serving on a helicopter gunship in Vietnam. He left the Marines in 1972, but felt the need to seek adventure and another cause. He chose to support peace and stability first in Israel, later in Zimbabwe/Rhodesia and finally in South Africa. Following a fateful landmine explosion in 1981, Dave sustained life threatening injuries that ultimately resulted in the amputation of both of his legs. After a lengthy rehabilitative period, he returned to active duty completing his military enlistment. Upon returning to the United States, he was reunited with his family and his 10-year-old Harley-Davidson® motorcycle. Inspired after his first ride since the explosion, Dave decided to travel around the world on his Harley. It was his hope that he would encourage others to overcome their obstacles and make their own dreams a reality. The Dave Barr Foundation was established to support charitable organizations, both in the U.S. and overseas, that are dedicated to improving the lives of the disabled.

item.title: 2011-06-03 Airdate - The Roeder's
item.description:
Guests
Guests George Roeder Will Roeder
Topics
George Roeder was one of the leading AMA Grand National racer during the 1960s. He won eight nationals during the 1960s and was a member of the Harley-Davidson factory racing team. In addition to being one of the top AMA dirt track racers, Roeder also piloted a Harley-Davidson streamliner to a land-speed record in 1965.

item.title: 2011-06-10 Airdate - A New Life
item.description:
Guests
Guests John Parham
Topics
John Parham is the President of J and P Cycles and the National Motorcycle Museum Board of Directors. John is also an organ donor recipient.

item.title: 2011-06-17 Airdate - Guinness World Record Journey
item.description:
Guests
Guests Jim Rogers
Topics
Jim Rogers is an author, word traveler and successful international investor. He has been frequently featured in Time, The Washington Post, The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, The Financial Times. After attending Yale and Oxford University, Rogers co-founded the Quantum Fund, a global-investment partnership. During 10 years, the portfolio gained 4200 percent, while the S and P rose less than 50 percent. Rogers then decided to retire - at age 37. In 1990-1992, Rogers fulfilled his lifelong dream: motorcycling 100,000 miles across six continents, a feat that landed him in the Guinness Book of World Records. As a private investor, he constantly analyzed the countries through which he traveled for investment ideas. He chronicled his journey in his bestseller book: Investment Biker. In 1999 - 2002 Jim also embarked on a Millennium Adventure. He traveled for 1101 days on his round-the-world, Guinness World Record journey.

item.title: 2011-06-24 Airdate - Saudi Journey
item.description:
Guests
Guests Stacey Ax Axman - Secretary MRF
Brad Gabriele - Dirt Bike Rider
Brian Page - Harley Rider
Topics
Part 1 - Stacey Axman is the secretary of the Motorcycle Riders Foundation in Washington DC
Part 2 - Brad Gabriele and Brian Page are both part of the Cleveland Clinic medical Lift Team. Provided medical treatment in Saudi Arabia for a member of the Saudi Royal Family. Stayed with the family in Riyadh and Jeddah.

item.title: 2011-06-30 Airdate - BMW ABS and Golden Segments
item.description: BMW AG says it will make anti-lock brakes standard equipment on all of its motorcycles for the 2012 model year. The German maker of cars and motorcycles began installing ABS on bikes in 1988 and for many years was the only mainstream bike maker company offering the feature on a range of models ......WSJ Plus, 14 past segments from the Biker Broadcasting vault.

item.title: 2011-07-12 Airdate - Fisher House and Rally
item.description: Our guests areColleen Billings and Luke Patrino from the "Run to Ohio Vietnam Veterans Memorial Wal and Rally". The Third Annual Run to Ohio Memorials, Wall and Rally is FREE. We also discuss about Fisher House. A program that is a unique private-public partnership that supports America's military in their time of need. The program recognizes the special sacrifices of our men and women in uniform and the hardships of military service by meeting a humanitarian need beyond that normally provided by the Departments of Defense and Veterans Affairs.

item.title: 2011-07-22 Airdate - Hoka Hey You
item.description: Get set for the Wild and Wonderful Mountainfest. Nichole Saffron, Marketing Director, talks about the music and fun and more. Plus, 4 venturous riders in the Hoka Hey Challange will ride from the Pacific to the Atlantic. They are Kurt Belcher, Jeff Kahn, Kelsey Dowell and Steve Nowak.

item.title: 2011-07-28 Airdate - Slovenia's Dark secret
item.description: Frank Dejak is only one of 4 survivors of the Slovenian Holocaust. He escaped the pit of death in 1945 where up to 45000 people were murdered by the Communist regime. The British government helped insure the deaths of thousands by deporting them back from a safe haven in Austria to the Communists in Slovenia. Frank is our guest on Biker Broadcasting which was recorded 50 years to the hour of his escape.

item.title: 2011-08-08 Airdate - USO Spectacular
item.description: This weeks show we talk to Bob Hope, nephew of the entertainer. He fills us in on the USO Poker Run. Betty Crowe, a volunteer for military families, calls all American's to help the armed forces in an enlightening interview. Veteran Luke Patrino returns to fill us in on details surrounding the 3/4 scale Veitnam Veterans Memorial Wall being erected August 17th in Montrose, Ohio. Lindsey and Russ Werle talk about getting married at Sturgess. And we check in with Charlie St Clair and friends from Sturgess.

item.title: 2011-08-22 Airdate - Giving Back
item.description: After John Kikol retired from a successful business career, he devoted his time to helping others. He has raised over 400,000 dollars at motorcycle rallies on behalf of U.S. soldiers, police officers and firefighters. Kikol has never served in the armed services or worn the uniform of a police officer or firefighter. But after 9/11 he became inspired.

item.title: 2011-09-03 Airdate - 1st Annual Labor Day Bash
item.description: In the middle of the fun that is our 1st Annual Labor Day Party, we decided to do a radio show. 3 fellow members of the Cleveland IronWorkers Local 17 of with Mr Z. is a member join us on air!

item.title: 7 Mile Isle Steel Drum Band
item.description: The 7 Mile Isle Steel Drum Band features original compositions with a Caribbean feel. Members of the band have traveled to Trinidad and Tobago, the home of the steel drum, and participated in Panorama. Band Members Joe Moxon - Lead Pan, Matt Dudack - Double Second Pan, Jeff Neitzke - Double Second Pan, Wilbur Krebs - Electric Bass, Jason Little - Drumset.
item.author: mlweb@comrec.com
item.itunes:subtitle: The 7 Mile Isle Steel Drum Band features original compositions with a Caribbean feel
item.itunes:summary: The 7 Mile Isle Steel Drum Band features original compositions with a Caribbean feel.
item.itunes:keywords: Original Steel Drum Band Music Live from Cleveland

item.title: Gabiel's Harp
item.description: Gabriel's Harp was started in 1996. Founding members met in church and just started playing Contemporary Christian music together. They have performed at a number of teen and youth events throughout the United States, Canada and Europe. They were part of Word Entertainment's ONE CD project, which also featured Rachael Lampa, Sixpence None the Richer, the Ragamuffins and Aaron Neville, among others. Gabriel's Harp has participated in music ministry for a number of World Youth Day events, beginning with Journeé Mondiale de la Jeunesse in 1997 through 2005 World Youth Day Events in Germany.
item.author: mlweb@comrec.com

item.title: Zach - Singer-Songwriter
item.description: Zach has garnished such awards as Best Singer/Songwriter and is a 3 time winner of Best Pop Act in the Cleveland Music Festival. He has received over 1,500 Spins on WAPS, was a finalist in the national Soul City Café Music Quest, receives over 190,000 hits and growing per month on the website, performs over 230 shows a year, had his Christmas song, On Christmas Morning spun on over 130 stations nationwide, was invited to perform at the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, is a regular at the New York Songwriter Circle.
item.author: mlweb@comrec.com
